section.title: Configure and use volume number weigher
section.para: OpenStack Block Storage enables you to choose a volume back end according to free_capacity and allocated_capacity. The volume number weigher feature lets the scheduler choose a volume back end based on its volume number in the volume back end. This can provide another means to improve the volume back ends’ I/O balance and the volumes’ I/O performance.

section.title: Enable volume number weigher
section.para: To enable a volume number weigher, set the scheduler_default_weighers to VolumeNumberWeigher flag in the cinder.conf file to define VolumeNumberWeigher as the selected weigher.

section.title: Configure multiple-storage back ends
section.para: To configure VolumeNumberWeigher, use LVMVolumeDriver as the volume driver.

section.title: Volume type
section.para: Define a volume type in Block Storage:
Create an extra specification that links the volume type to a back-end name:
section.screen: $ openstack volume type set lvm --property volume_backend_name=LVM
section.para: This example creates a lvm volume type with volume_backend_name=LVM as extra specifications.

section.title: Usage
section.para: To create six 1-GB volumes, run the openstack volume create --size 1 --type lvm volume1 command six times:
This command creates three volumes in stack-volumes and three volumes in stack-volumes-1.
